name: Victorian Four-Poster Bed
description: Dark mahogany bed with carved floral motifs. Burgundy velvet bedspread with protective charms sewn into corners.

name: Oak Writing Desk
description: Sturdy oak desk facing the window. Holds papers, ledgers, quills, ink bottles, magnifying glass, and brass serpent-shaped letter opener.

name: Tiffany Desk Lamp
description: Amber stained glass lamp providing warm light over the desk. Functional yet slightly anachronistic.

name: Bookshelves
description: Floor-to-ceiling shelves with Victorian tomes, grimoires, European warding manuals, and indigenous magical studies.

name: Armchair
description: Victorian armchair with firm cushioning, placed near desk for reading.

name: Wooden Stool
description: Simple wooden stool for brief meditation or ritual setup.

name: Mirror with Protective Sigils
description: Ornate mirror etched with subtle protective sigils.

mechanics.effect: Detects minor scrying attempts within the room

name: Locked Cabinet of Thaumaturgical Reagents
description: Contains protective oils, scrolls, and ritual materials. Unlocking sequence known only to Dr. Ashford.

mechanics.security: Requires knowledge of sequence or lockpicking
mechanics.effect: Contents maintain potency due to sealed wards

name: Framed Family Portrait
description: Portrait of Margaret's Philadelphia family (1870s). Evokes measured nostalgia.

name: Persian-Style Rug
description: Faded rug covering polished hardwood floor. Maintained meticulously.

name: Curtains with Protective Threads
description: Dark green curtains with subtle wards woven into the fabric.

mechanics.effect: Reduces magical detection or intrusion attempts through windows

name: Brass Bowl with Herbs
description: Lavender and sage for calming and protective purposes. Subtle magical effect.

mechanics.effect: Slight protection against minor psychic or fae influence

name: Small Horse Figurine
description: Carved figurine representing Aonbharr, placed near window sill unconsciously by Dr. Ashford.

name: Cork Panel for Research Notes
description: Small cork panel on bookshelves to pin maps, notes, and temporary research reminders.

name: Desk Bell
description: Used to summon Aonbharrâ€™s caretaker. Brass, small, functional.

name: Protective Chalk Wards
description: Faint wards drawn around corners to protect against intrusion or observation.

name: Ink Sigils
description: Drawn near desk and bed using ink; subtle but effective protection.

mechanics.effect: Enhances personal protection spells within room

name: Seiko QX Series Alarm Clock
description: Compact Seiko analog alarm clock used to keep track of research schedules and personal appointments.

name: Sony Quartz Digital Desk Clock
description: Small Sony digital desk clock with LCD display, backlight, and precision quartz movement. Placed on writing desk to monitor work sessions.

name: Sharp EL-506T Calculator
description: Mid-90s desktop calculator for arithmetic, formula work, and magical calculations. Practical and efficient for a scholar.

name: Brass Candlestick with Beeswax Candle
description: Tall brass candlestick holding an unscented beeswax candle. Used in protective rituals and warding exercises.

name: Leather-Bound Grimoire of European Warding
description: A well-worn grimoire containing centuries-old European protective spells and sigils.

mechanics.effect: Provides +1 to Ward rolls when used as reference

name: Loose Parchment Scrolls
description: Bundles of parchment with marginal notes, diagrams, and incomplete rituals.

name: Brass Mortar and Pestle
description: Used to grind herbs, powders, and resins for ritual purposes. Functional and well-maintained.

mechanics.roll: Mental + Dexterity (Difficulty 2) to produce correct consistency

name: Glass Vials of Protective Oils
description: Small glass vials containing oils for wards, anti-scrying, and other protective spells.

mechanics.effect: Enhances protective spells cast using oil

name: Quill Pen Set
description: Set of unused and used quill pens, ink wells, and blotting paper for meticulous research notes and spell diagrams.

name: Phoenix City Map (1995 Edition)
description: Folded street map of Phoenix from 1995, used for research, exploration, and magical geography studies.

mechanics.roll: Perception + Mental (Difficulty 1) to identify locations or routes

name: Small Wooden Ritual Table
description: Compact table near the desk for laying out ritual components and spell diagrams.

name: Magnifying Glass on Stand
description: Used to examine fine details in texts, sigils, and ritual diagrams.

mechanics.roll: Perception + Mental (Difficulty 1) to detect hidden details

name: Small Brass Hourglass
description: Decorative yet functional hourglass measuring 30 minutes. Used to time rituals or meditation sessions.

mechanics.effect: Provides a visual measure for timed rituals or breaks
